greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 2^(n*(n-1)/2)*n!.
comment: Let A = the sum of the n-th powers of the first 2^{n-1} terms of A001969, and similarly let B = the sum of the n-th powers of the first 2^{n-1} terms of A000069. Then a(n) = |A-B|. - _Jeffrey Shallit_, Nov 29 2019
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..77
Richard P. Stanley, Acyclic Orientations of Graphs, Discrete Mathematics, 5 (1973), pages 171-178, doi:10.1016/0012-365X(73)90108-8
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
